author: hdmoadmin
title: Now Playing
text:
1:30 pm - October 09, 2015 Now Playing 
Below is a list of movies playing in Fort Smith. Show times and information are available at www.carmike.com and www.malco.com . 
Black Mass — Johnny Depp portrays Whitey Bulger, an infamous, real-life criminal who worked as an FBI informant in Boston. Bulger was assigned to help take down a mobster family that was setting up camp in his own area. Co-stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Joel Edgerton, Dakota Johnson. (R) 
Everest in 3D — What begins as a run-of-the-mill expedition at Mount Everest turns quickly into trajedy when a massive snow storm hits the area in director Baltasar Kormakur’s new drama. Stars Ang Phula Sherpa, Jason Clarke, Thomas M. Wright, Tom Goodman-Hill, Charlotte Boving, Martin Henderson and Pemba Sherpa. (PG-13) 
Fantastic Four — The quartet of heroes battle the diabolical Doctor Doom. (PG-13) 
The Green Inferno — Student activists embark on a trip to the Amazon, with the plan to save the rain forest in this new thriller. The students harbor good intentions, but they soon learn that they aren’t alone in the forest, and they see that no good deed goes without punishment. Stars Aaron Burns, Lorenza Izzo and Ariel Levy. (R) 
Hotel Transylvania 2 in 3D — Dracula and his closest, equally memorable friends do their best to bring out the monster in Dracula’s half-vampire, half-human grandson in this animated sequel. Dracula simply wants to keep Mavis from leaving the notorious hotel. Features the voices of Adam Sandler, Selena Gomez, Kevin James, Andy Samberg, Steve Buscemi, Megan Mullally, Keegan-Michael Key and David Spade. (PG) 
Inside Out — A girl’s emotions take physical shape and greet her in this recent animated film. (PG) 
The Intern — Ben Whittaker (Robert De Niro) is a 70-year-old man who is a widower and retired. Ben finds retirement to be nothing like he imagined, so he re-enters the workforce as a senior intern for an online fashion company operated by Jules Ostin (Anne Hathaway). Also stars Rene Russo, JoJo Krushner, Andrew Rannells, Adam DeVine, Linda Lavin, Anders Holm and Zack Pearlman. (PG-13) 
Jurassic World — Twenty-two years after the events seen in the first “Jurassic Park” movie, Isla Nublar now features a fully functioning dinosaur theme park. A new attraction is created but begins to backfire. (PG-13) 
Man From U.N.C.L.E. — CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kruyakin fight against an evil organization associated with nuclear weapons. (PG-13) 
The Martian in 3D — Director Ridley Scott’s new film follows Mark Watney (Matt Damon), an astronaut who is presumed dead during his mission to Mars. Stranded and alone, Mark must rely on his intellect and his courage to survive and somehow make contact with his colleagues on Earth. Co-stars Kristen Wiig, Jessica Chastain, Michael Pena, Jeff Daniels, Sean Bean, Kata Mara and Sebastian Stan. (PG-13) 
Maze Runner: Scorch Trials — The continuing saga sees Thomas (Dylan O’Brien) and his fellow Gladers on their most difficult mission to date. They must search for clues about the mysterious, dangerous WCKD organization. The colleagues find themselves in a desert-like setting and seemingly impossible barriers. Co-stars Kaya Scodelario and Thomas Brodie-Sangster. (PG-13) 
90 Minutes in Heaven — A man who is involved in a terrifying vehicle accident is pronounced dead, but comes back to life less than two hours after the incident. The man shocks many with his claims that he, while unconscious for 90 minutes, saw Heaven. Stars Hayden Christensen, Kate Bosworth, Hudson Meek, Elizabeth Hunter, David Clyde Carr, Dwight Yoakam, Michael W. Smith and Bobby Batson. (PG-13) 
No Escape — A family is caught in the middle of a coup in this new thriller from director-co-writer John Erick Dowdle. The family desperately searches for a way to escape from the area, which now sees foreigners being immediately killed. Stars Lake Bell, Owen Wilson, Pierce Brosnan and Sahajak Boonthanakit. (R) 
Pan in 3D — The famous orphan is seen in the memorable, magical world of Neverland, where excitement and danger both away him. The orphan is faced with multiple hurdles while trying to discover and obtain his destiny. He hopes to survive, but he might become a hero for the ages known as Peter Pan. Stars Hugh Jackman, Levi Miller, Jimmy (PG) 
The Perfect Guy — Lobbyist Leah Vaughn (Sanaa Lathan) navigates past a breakup and steps into a passionate relationship with a stranger (Michael Ealy). When Leah’s former boyfriend (Morris Chestnut) re-enters the picture, Leah can’t decide who she should fear and who she should trust. (PG-13) 
Pixels — Video game characters come to life to stress out Adam Sandler and others. (PG-13) 
Sicario — An FBI agent who is enlisted by a special task force is asked to help in a secret, dangerous mission in director Denis Villeneuve’s drama-filled movie. The agent’s latest assignment is to help in the war against drugs near the U.S./Mexico border. Stars Emily Blunt, Josh Brolin, Benicio Del Toro, Raoul Trujillo, Daniel Kaluuya, Kim Larrichio and Kevin Wiggins. (R) 
Sleeping With Other People — A habitual cheater and a well-liked womanizer forge a platnoic friendship in an effort to change their lifestyles. As the friendship grows, deeper feelings begin to emerge between the two. Stars Alison Brie, Jason Sudeikis, Amanda Peet, Jordan Carlos, Margarita Levieva, Adam Brody, Charles Cain and Adam Scott. (R) 
Straight Outta Compton — O’Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins, Neil Brown Jr., Jason Mitchell, Paul Giamatti and Aldis Hodge co-star in this film from director F. Gary Gray, which traces the rise of hip hop pioneers NWA from the dangerous streets of California to mainstream superstars. (R) 
The Visit — Two young grandchildren go to visit their grandparents, a meeting that unleashes a strange, dangerous chain of events for all of the family in this new thriller from director M. Night Shyamalan (“The Sixith Sense”). Stars Olivia DeJonge, Deanna Dunagan, Ed Oxenbould, Peter McRobbie, Kathryn Hahn and Celia Keenan-Bolger. (PG-13) 
A Walk in the Woods — After living in England for 20 years, Bill Bryson returns to the United States in this new drama. Bill thinks the best way for him to reconnect with his home country is to take along a long-time friend for a memorable hike on the Appalachian Trail. Stars Robert Redford and Nick Nolte. (R) 
War Room — Director-co-writer Alex Kendrick’s new film examines a family that seemingly has everything, including the envy of others. The relatives, despite their perfect outward appearances, turn to Miss Clara, an older, wiser woman, in hopes of fixing their family’s numerous problems. Stars T.C. Stallings, Priscilla C. Shirer, Beth Moore and Jain Harris. (PG)
